intro: Acrorumohra undulata, commonly known as the wavy-leaf fern, is a unique species characterized by its delicate, undulating fronds. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. The plant features compound leaves with a distinctive wavy margin, which contributes to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining, moist soil. Its reproductive structures are borne on spore-bearing spikes, typical of its fern classification.
